title: Introduction to Environmental Processes
description: Quantitative exploration of physical and chemical processes relevant to the environment and their applications to complex environmental systems. Focuses on calculus-based tools. Key concepts include fluid mechanics, heat transfer, mass transfer, particle mechanics, turbulence, and physicochemical processes.

conditions.restricted_to_majors: environmental sciences and Earth sciences majors.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): ESCI 100A, and MATH 11B or MATH 19B, and CHEM 1C, and PHYS 6B or PHYS 5B.  Enrollment is restricted to environmental sciences and Earth sciences majors.

class_notes: Enroll in lecture and associated discussion section
